ðŸš€ actual | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Personal finance tracking and budgeting
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Local-first personal finance management â€¢ Free and open-source â€¢ Cross-device synchronization â€¢ Envelope budgeting support â€¢ Migration guides from other budgeting apps
ðŸ“– Summary: Actual is a local-first, open-source personal finance application designed for budgeting and tracking expenses. It offers cross-device synchronization and supports envelope budgeting. The application provides migration guides to help users transition from other budgeting tools.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ arch-cleaner | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Routine maintenance and cleanup of Arch Linux systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ System updates â€¢ Orphaned package removal â€¢ Pacman cache cleaning â€¢ Journal log cleaning â€¢ Temporary file removal
ðŸ“– Summary: Arch-Cleaner is a bash script designed to automate routine maintenance and cleanup tasks on Arch Linux systems. It offers features such as system updates, removal of orphaned packages, cleaning the Pacman cache and journal logs, and temporary file removal. The script also includes options for emptying the trash and rebooting the system after cleanup.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ Chain-of-Zoom | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Achieving extreme super-resolution beyond the training regime of existing models without retraining.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Extreme Super-Resolution â€¢ Scale Autoregression â€¢ Preference Alignment â€¢ Model-agnostic framework â€¢ Multi-scale-aware prompts
ðŸ“– Summary: Chain-of-Zoom is a model-agnostic framework for extreme super-resolution. It utilizes an autoregressive chain of intermediate scale-states with multi-scale-aware prompts to magnify images beyond the capabilities of traditionally trained models. The framework also incorporates a VLM prompt extractor fine-tuned through GRPO to align text guidance towards human preference.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ glauth | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: LDAP authentication for development, home use, or CI environments.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lightweight LDAP server â€¢ Configurable backends (file, SQL, LDAP proxy) â€¢ Two-factor authentication â€¢ Centralized account management â€¢ Manages SSH keys and Linux accounts
ðŸ“– Summary: GLAuth is a lightweight and configurable LDAP server designed for development, home use, and CI environments. It offers features like configurable backends (file, SQL, LDAP proxy), two-factor authentication, and centralized account management. It can manage SSH keys and Linux accounts, providing a simpler alternative to OpenLDAP or Active Directory.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ pyinfra | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating infrastructure tasks by writing Python code that executes shell commands on servers, Docker containers, or the local machine.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fast execution over thousands of hosts â€¢ Realtime debugging output â€¢ Idempotent operations â€¢ Extendable with Python packages â€¢ Agentless execution
ðŸ“– Summary: pyinfra is a Python-based infrastructure automation tool that allows users to define infrastructure as code and execute it on various targets, including SSH servers, Docker containers, and the local machine. It focuses on speed, idempotency, and extensibility, offering features like real-time debugging and integrations with popular tools like Docker and Terraform.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ gemini-cli | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: The Gemini CLI is primarily used to interact with the Gemini AI model from the command line to automate tasks, query codebases, and generate new applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Query and edit large codebases beyond Gemini's 1M token context window. â€¢ Generate new apps from PDFs or sketches using Gemini's multimodal capabilities. â€¢ Automate operational tasks. â€¢ Connect new capabilities using tools and MCP servers.
ðŸ“– Summary: The Gemini CLI is an open-source tool that allows users to leverage the power of the Gemini AI model directly from their terminal. It enables users to query and edit large codebases, generate applications from various inputs, automate operational tasks, and integrate with other tools and services.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ dgmjs | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating diagrams, drawings, and sketches on an infinite canvas with smart shapes and real-time collaboration.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Smart shapes with scripting and constraints â€¢ Infinite canvas â€¢ Multi-page support â€¢ Hand-drawn styles â€¢ Real-time collaboration
ðŸ“– Summary: DGM.js is a TypeScript library for creating an infinite canvas with smart shapes. It supports features like scripting, constraints, multi-page support, hand-drawn styles, real-time collaboration, and various export formats. It is suitable for building diagramming, drawing, and sketching applications.
